snippet: The company said a strong second quarter prompted it to increase its full-year outlook.
abstract: Home Depot says that strong cost controls and healthy sales helped lift its net income by 12.4 percent in the second quarter; company increases its full-year outlook, citing its performance in the first half; for the quarter that ended July 29, Home Depot earned $1.53 billion, or $1.01 a share, compared with $1.36 billion, or 87 cents a share, a year earlier; revenue climbed to $20.57 billion from $20.23 billion.
lead_paragraph: The company said a strong second quarter prompted it to increase its full-year outlook.

headline.main: Home Depot Sales Perk Up in Markets Hit the Hardest
headline.print_headline: Home Depot Sales Perk Up In Markets Hit the Hardest
